titleStmt.title: Poor Robin's jests: or, The compleat jester Being a collection of several jests not heretofore published. Now newly composed and written by that well-known gentleman, Poor Robin, knight of the burnt island, and well-willer to the mathematicks. Together with the true and lively effigies of the said author. Licensed Feb. 2. 1666. Roger L'Estrange.
titleStmt.author: Poor Robin.
Winstanley, William, 1628?-1698.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Francis Kirkman and Richard Head,

notesStmt.note: William Winstanley is usually credited with authorship of the Poor Robin pamphlets (cf. NUC pre-1956 imprints).
Imperfect; stained and tightly bound; all after p. 140 lacking; pp. 141-150 appear from a different work entirely; caption title reads: The universal jester: or, A compeat book of jests.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
